item.title: Concord Chorus 将以 14 亿美元收购音乐投资商 Hipgnosis Songs Fund
item.description: 音乐和戏剧版权公司 Concord Chorus 已同意以 14 亿美元的价格收购英国音乐投资商 Hipgnosis Songs Fund。【原文：Concord Chorus, a music and theatrical rights firm, has agreed to acquire British music investor Hipgnosis Songs Fund for $1.40 billion, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: ACEA 称复活节提前导致欧盟 3 月新车销量下降 5.2
item.description: 欧洲汽车行业机构周四表示，受复活节假期提前和市场低迷的影响，3月份欧盟新车销量同比下降了5.2%，这是今年以来的首次下降，也是自2022年7月以来的最大降幅。【原文：New car sales in the European Union fell by 5.2% year-on-year in March, marking the first decline this year and the biggest since July 2022, Europe's auto industry body said on Thursday, citing the impact of early Easter holidays and a market downturn.】

item.title: 英国易捷航空公司削减冬季亏损，称夏季需求增加
item.description: 英国易捷航空公司（EasyJet）表示，与去年相比，该公司的冬季亏损已减少了 5000 多万英镑（6234 万美元），而且对其航班和假期的需求正在为关键的夏季旺季而增加。【原文：British airline easyJet said it had reduced its winter losses by more than 50 million pounds ($62.34 million) compared with last year and demand for its flights and holidays was building for the key summer season.】

item.title: 苹果公司计划投资超过 2.5 亿美元扩建新加坡园区
item.description: 根据苹果公司 4 月 17 日的一份声明，该公司计划投资超过 2.5 亿美元，以扩大其在新加坡宏茂桥的地区园区或业务。【原文：Apple Inc plans to invest more than $250 million to expand its regional campus or operations in Ang Mo Kio, Singapore, according to a company statement dated April 17.】

item.title: 中国央行警告不要 "片面 "追求信贷扩张
item.description: 在数据显示银行贷款放缓之后，中国央行周四警告说，不要 "片面 "追求信贷扩张，并誓言将信贷质量置于信贷规模之上，同时采取行动盘活现有贷款。【原文：China's central bank cautioned on Thursday against a "one-sided" pursuit of credit expansion after data showed a slowdown in bank lending, vowing to prioritise the quality of credit over size and move to revitalise existing loans.】

item.title: 美股震荡可能推动波动率挂钩基金加大抛售力度
item.description: 与波动性挂钩的投资策略正在加入美股的抛售潮，如果市场波动继续加剧，这些策略可能会帮助美股加速下跌。【原文：Volatility-linked investment strategies are joining the nascent sell-off in U.S. stocks and could help accelerate declines if market gyrations keep increasing.】

item.title: 投资者要求道达尔能源公司在五月份股东大会前分拆首席执行官和董事会主席职务
item.description: 法国石油巨头道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）的一批投资者呼吁该公司拆分首席执行官和董事长的角色，他们认为这可以加快该公司摆脱化石燃料的步伐。【原文：A group of investors in French oil major TotalEnergies is calling for the company to split the roles of CEO and chairman, which they say could speed up its shift away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: ABB 第一季度盈利超出预期
item.description: 瑞士工程公司 ABB 周四表示，年初利润好于预期，并预测未来几个月收入将加速增长、【原文：ABB reported better than expected profit at the start of the year and forecast faster revenue growth in the coming months, the Swiss engineering company said on Thursday,】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，WeWork 正在寻求资金以摆脱破产困境，Adam Neumann 正着手回购 WeWork。
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，WeWork 公司创始人亚当-诺伊曼（Adam Neumann）在寻求数亿美元资金以摆脱破产并避免被出售的同时，再次推动了对公司的回购。【原文：WeWork Inc founder Adam Neumann has made a fresh push to buy back the firm even as it seeks hundreds of millions of dollars to emerge from bankruptcy and avoid a sale, FT reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：科技、外汇乌云散去
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 特斯拉试图通过法律 "创可贴 "重启马斯克的巨额薪酬协议
item.description: 法律专家说，特斯拉和埃隆-马斯克正在利用公司法中的一个模糊条款，试图恢复马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬福利，这一未经检验的举动可能会使公司再次陷入诉讼泥潭。【原文：Tesla and Elon Musk are seizing upon an obscure provision in corporate law to attempt to restore Musk's $56 billion pay package, in an untested move that could again mire the company in litigation, legal experts said.】

item.title: 欧盟领导人将听取与全球竞争对手竞争所需的改革方案
item.description: 周四，欧盟领导人将听取该集团如何采取行动，在新的绿色和数字技术的全球竞赛中赶上美国、中国和其他竞争对手。【原文：European Union leaders will hear on Thursday how the bloc could act to catch up to the United States, China and other rivals in a global race in new green and digital technologies.】

item.title: 沃尔玛支持的 Ibotta 在美国 IPO 的目标估值高达 27 亿美元
item.description: 沃尔玛支持的数字营销公司 Ibotta 在周三进行首次公开募股定价后，可能将以 26.7 亿美元的估值融资 5.773 亿美元。【原文：Walmart -backed digital marketing company Ibotta will likely raise $577.3 million at a valuation of $2.67 billion, after pricing its initial public offering on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，韩国 LG 电子计划通过美元债券融资最多 10 亿美元
item.description: 据三位直接了解此事的消息人士称，韩国 LG 电子公司的目标是通过美元债券交易筹集高达 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：South Korea's LG Electronics is aiming to raise up to $1 billion in a dollar bond deal, according to three sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中国华为开始销售 Pura 70 智能手机
item.description: 中国科技企业集团华为（HWT.UL）表示，将于周四晚些时候开始销售 Pura 70 ultra 和 Pura 70 Pro 智能手机。【原文：Chinese technology conglomerate Huawei (HWT.UL) said it would start selling Pura 70 ultra and Pura 70 Pro smartphones later on Thursday.】

item.title: 美元暂停飙升，亚洲股市涨跌不一
item.description: 周四，亚洲股市在涨跌不一的盘中悄然走高，而美元则稍事喘息，债券市场也因投资者回避评估利率前景而趋于稳定。【原文：Asian stocks crept higher in a mixed session on Thursday, while the dollar took a breather and bond markets steadied as investors stepped back to assess the interest rate outlook.】

item.title: 日本央行野口称短期政策利率调整可能缓慢
item.description: 日本央行董事会成员野口旭周四表示，央行调整短期政策利率的步伐将是缓慢的，其速度无法与其他主要央行相比。【原文：Bank of Japan board member Asahi Noguchi said on Thursday that the pace of adjustment in short-term policy rate of the central bank will be slow and made at a pace that cannot be compared to that of other major central banks.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 3 月就业人数令人失望，失业率上升
item.description: 澳大利亚 3 月份的就业率在上个月大幅上升后有所下降，而失业率则恢复了上升趋势，这表明相对紧张的劳动力市场仍在按部就班地放松，尽管速度有所放缓。【原文：Australian employment fell in March after an enormous gain the month before while the jobless rate resumed its uptrend, a sign that the relatively tight labour market was still on track to loosen, albeit at a slower pace.】

item.title: 投资者思考美国利率前景，美元得以喘息
item.description: 美元周四走软，因为交易员们在美联储官员发表言论巩固了货币政策在一段时间内仍将保持限制性的预期之后，对美国利率前景进行了评估。【原文：The dollar was soft on Thursday as traders assessed the U.S. interest rates outlook in the wake of comments from Federal Reserve officials that cemented expectation of monetary settings remaining restrictive for a while longer.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求强劲，台积电第一季度利润将增长 5
item.description: 台湾中芯国际集成电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.，简称 "台积电"）是人工智能应用领域先进芯片的主要生产商，由于需求强劲，预计本周四公布的第一季度利润将增长 5%。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , , the dominant producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 5% rise in first-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to strong demand.】

item.title: 甲骨文将在日本投资 80 多亿美元发展云计算和人工智能
item.description: 甲骨文公司周三表示，未来10年将投资80多亿美元，以满足日本对云计算和人工智能基础设施的需求。【原文：Oracle said on Wednesday it will invest more than $8 billion over the next 10 years to meet demand for cloud computing and AI infrastructure in Japan.】

item.title: 韩国市场监察机构敦促企业认真倾听股东意见
item.description: 韩国金融监管机构负责人周四表示，公司应更多地关注股东的声音，因为政府正努力通过改革来鼓励提高股东回报，从而推动国内股市的发展。【原文：South Korea's financial watchdog chief said on Thursday companies should pay more attention to shareholder voices, as the government seeks to boost the domestic stock market by bringing in reforms to encourage higher shareholder returns.】

item.title: 美国重新对委内瑞拉实施石油制裁后，石油价格上涨
item.description: 在美国表示将恢复对委内瑞拉的石油制裁，而欧盟则表示将对伊朗实施新的限制措施之后，油价在周四的早盘交易中上涨，略微收窄了上一交易日的跌幅。【原文：Oil prices rose in early trade on Thursday, slightly paring the previous session's losses after the United States said it would reinstate oil sanctions Venezuela, while the European Union talked of fresh curbs on Iran.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，美光将从美国获得 60 亿美元的芯片资助
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美光科技公司（Micron Technology Inc）将从美国商务部获得超过 60 亿美元的拨款，以帮助支付国内芯片工厂项目的费用。【原文：Micron Technology Inc is set to get more than $6 billion in grants from the U.S. Commerce Department to help pay for domestic chip factory projects, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 民意调查显示，日本企业认为英文披露要求是一种负担
item.description: 在路透社每月一次的企业调查中，几乎所有日本公司都认为，东京证券交易所计划要求顶级公司用英语披露关键财务报表是一种负担。【原文：Almost all Japanese companies in a Reuters monthly corporate poll see the Tokyo Stock Exchange's planned requirement to have top-tier firms disclose key financial statements in English as a burden.】

item.title: 梅斯特说："美联储将在'某个时候'下调美国利率，但不急于一时
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长洛雷塔-梅斯特（Loretta Mester）周三表示，她预计今年的物价压力将进一步缓解，从而允许美联储降低借贷成本，但只有当美联储 "非常有信心 "通胀率将持续迈向2%的目标时才会这样做。【原文：Cleveland Federal Reserve Bank President Loretta Mester said on Wednesday she expects price pressures to ease further this year, allowing the Fed to reduce borrowing costs, but only when it is "pretty confident" inflation is heading sustainably to its 2% goal.】

item.title: 数据显示，外国持有的美国国债创历史新高；日本持有的美国国债增加
item.description: 美国财政部周三公布的数据显示，2月份外国持有的美国国债数量激增，创下了连续第五个月上升的纪录。【原文：Foreign holdings of U.S. Treasuries surged to a record in February, its fifth straight monthly rise, Treasury Department data released on Wednesday showed.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，瑞银计划在整合瑞士信贷时进行下一轮裁员
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，瑞银集团在收购瑞士信贷后正计划进行新一轮裁员，预计将影响该集团全球投资银行的一百多个职位。【原文：UBS Group is planning another round of job cuts after its takeover of Credit Suisse that is expected to affect over a hundred positions across the group's global investment bank, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：投资者稍事喘息，外汇交易愈演愈烈
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 由于费率居高不下，Equifax 第二季度收入低于预期
item.description: 信用评级公司 Equifax 周三预测其第二季度收入低于预期，因为强劲的经济数据提高了利率长期维持在较高水平的可能性，可能会推迟抵押贷款市场的复苏。【原文：Credit ratings firm Equifax forecast on Wednesday its second-quarter revenue below estimates after strong economic data boosted chances of rates staying higher-for-longer, potentially delaying a recovery in the mortgage market.】
